item.title: Where di I add commands?
item.dc:creator: @rockh4rd rockh4rd
item.description:
@rockh4rd wrote:

[code]if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("::runes")){
addItem(561,10000);
addItem(562,10000);
addItem(563,10000);
addItem(564,10000);
addItem(565,10000);
addItem(566,10000);
addItem(560,10000);
addItem(559,10000);
addItem(558,10000);
addItem(557,10000);
addItem(556,10000);
addItem(555,10000);
addItem(554,10000);
sendMessage(“You got some runes”);

PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName+" Got some ::runes";
}[/code]
^
code there wrong

[code]if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“runes”)){
addItem(561,10000);
addItem(562,10000);
addItem(563,10000);
addItem(564,10000);
addItem(565,10000);
addItem(566,10000);
addItem(560,10000);
addItem(559,10000);
addItem(558,10000);
addItem(557,10000);
addItem(556,10000);
addItem(555,10000);
addItem(554,10000);
sendMessage(“You got some runes”);

PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName+" Got some runes";
}[/code]
^
write

ctrl + f

find

"home" or "starter"

and add them underneath

item.title: Where di I add commands?

item.description:
@K_Jay wrote:

Open up client.java search for code[/code] not the custom command! just the command. then add the command under the last } of the command

item.title: Where di I add commands?
item.dc:creator: @andrej1349 andrej1349
item.description:
@andrej1349 wrote:

where do i add commands in server:

i got this command to spawn all runes in inventory

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("::runes")){
addItem(561,10000);
addItem(562,10000);
addItem(563,10000);
addItem(564,10000);
addItem(565,10000);
addItem(566,10000);
addItem(560,10000);
addItem(559,10000);
addItem(558,10000);
addItem(557,10000);
addItem(556,10000);
addItem(555,10000);
addItem(554,10000);
sendMessage(“You got some runes”);

PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName+" Got some ::runes";
}

WHERE I PUT IT
